title: Requires that certain information be printed on appearance tickets for alleged traffic infractions
summary: Requires that certain information be printed on appearance tickets for alleged traffic infractions.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

       Introduced  by M. of A. BING, CUSICK, PHEFFER, ABBATE, DINOWITZ, ZEBROW-
         SKI, REILLY, BROOK-KRASNY, SPANO -- Multi-Sponsored by  --  M.  of  A.
         BOYLAND,   CAHILL,  COOK,  GABRYSZAK,  GOTTFRIED,  HEASTIE,  JEFFRIES,
         MAISEL,  McENENY,  ROBINSON,  SCARBOROUGH,  TITUS  --  read  once  and
         referred to the Committee on Codes

       AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to the inclusion
         of certain information on an appearance ticket; and to amend the vehi-
         cle  and  traffic  law,  in relation to suspensions for failure to pay
         driver responsibility assessments

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  This  act shall be known and may be cited as the "traffic
    2  violations fair notice act".
    3    S 2. Section 150.10 of the criminal procedure law is amended by adding
    4  a new subdivision 3 to read as follows:
    5    3.  WHENEVER AN APPEARANCE TICKET, AS DEFINED IN  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF
    6  THIS  SECTION,  IS  ISSUED  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION
    7  150.20 OF THIS ARTICLE TO A PERSON ALLEGING AN OFFENSE  OF  THE  VEHICLE
    8  AND  TRAFFIC  LAW,  SUCH  APPEARANCE  TICKET  SHALL  CONTAIN LANGUAGE IN
    9  ACCORDANCE WITH SUBDIVISION TWO  OF  THIS  SECTION,  AND  SHALL  CONTAIN
   10  LANGUAGE NOTIFYING THE DEFENDANT OF:
   11    (A)  THE  MAXIMUM  FINE  SCHEDULE  ESTABLISHED BY SECTION ONE THOUSAND
   12  EIGHT HUNDRED ONE OF THE VEHICLE AND TRAFFIC LAW;
   13    (B) HOW THE NUMBER OF POINTS ON YOUR LICENSE AFFECTS YOUR  ABILITY  TO
   14  MAINTAIN A DRIVER'S LICENSE, AS SET FORTH IN 15 NYCRR S 131.4;
   15    (C)  THE  DRIVER  RESPONSIBILITY  ASSESSMENT PROGRAM ESTABLISHED UNDER
   16  SECTION FIVE HUNDRED THREE OF THE VEHICLE AND TRAFFIC LAW,  TO  WHOM  IT
   17  APPLIES, AND THE FINE SCHEDULE THAT ACCOMPANIES IT; AND
   18    (D)  THE MAXIMUM SURCHARGES THAT MAY BE APPLIED AGAINST A DRIVER IF HE
   19  OR SHE PLEADS GUILTY TO THE ALLEGED INFRACTION.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00657-01-1

       A. 1126                             2

    1    S 3. Section 510 of the vehicle and traffic law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 4-f to read as follows:
    3    4-F.  SUSPENSION  FOR FAILURE TO PAY DRIVER RESPONSIBILITY ASSESSMENT.
    4  BEFORE THE DEPARTMENT MAY SUSPEND THE DRIVER'S LICENSE OR PRIVILEGES  OF
    5  ANY PERSON WHO FAILS TO PAY THE DRIVER RESPONSIBILITY ASSESSMENT IMPOSED
    6  UPON HIM OR HER BY THE DEPARTMENT PURSUANT TO SECTION FIVE HUNDRED THREE
    7  OF THIS ARTICLE, THE DEPARTMENT MUST HAVE SENT SUCH PERSON NOTICES STAT-
    8  ING  THAT  HE  OR  SHE  HAS  FAILED TO PAY THE REQUIRED ASSESSMENT. SUCH
    9  NOTICES MUST BE SENT TO THE LAST KNOWN ADDRESS OF THE INDIVIDUAL ON  TWO
   10  SEPARATE  OCCASIONS, EACH OCCASION OCCURRING AT LEAST THIRTY DAYS APART.
   11  IF THE ASSESSMENT REMAINS UNPAID THIRTY DAYS AFTER THE SECOND AND  FINAL
   12  NOTICE  HAS BEEN SENT, THE DEPARTMENT MAY SUSPEND THE DRIVING PRIVILEGES
   13  OF SUCH PERSON. SUCH SUSPENSION SHALL TAKE EFFECT IMMEDIATELY.
   14    S 4. The commissioner of motor vehicles shall implement  any  rule  or
   15  regulation  necessary  to  implement  the  provisions of this act on its
   16  effective date. This shall include determining the language  that  shall
   17  appear  on the ticket in accordance with the provisions of subdivision 3
   18  of section 150.10 of the criminal procedure law.
   19    S 5. This act shall take effect immediately; except that  section  two
   20  of  this act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after it
   21  shall have become a law.
